messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
The address is 1680 Ray Road. We have a baby missing out of her crib.
Okay, do you know who might have taken her?
No, ma'am.
How old is she?
She's 11 months old.
Okay, and can you confirm your address one more time?
1680 Ray Road, yes, ma'am.
Alright, and your last name?
My last name is Irizari. The baby's last name is Creech.
Is the mother there?
Yes, ma'am.
What’s her first name?
Michelle.
What was she last seen wearing?
She was wearing pink pajamas that say 'Daddy.'
Okay, calm down, it's okay. The father just got home from Iraq a few hours ago?
Yes, we went into the bedroom to get the baby, and the window to the baby's room is open.
When was the last time someone saw her?
Just after 11:30 last night when Michelle fed her.
Okay, the dad just got home today and went to get the baby up, she was gone?
Yes, ma'am.
Is the dad's name Ronald?
Yes, ma'am.
Did he just get home from Iraq?
Yes.
Her bib is on the ground? Don't touch it.
Okay, we won't touch anything.
It's okay. I need you to stay calm to help me help them. Do you know anyone who might have access to the house?
Not that I know of. Michelle, do you know anyone who might have access to the house?
The bedroom window was open.
Make sure no one touches anything near the window. Is there anything else missing?
The baby's diaper bag and some of her clothes are gone.
Was the window shut when she was put to bed?
Yes, ma'am. The window was shut.
Is it a house or a mobile home?
It's a house.
Was the window locked?
I think it was locked.
Do you see anything else out of place without touching anything?
No, nothing else seems out of order.
Tell Ron not to touch anything. Are the deputies there with you now?
Yes, ma'am.
Okay, I’ll let you hang up now.
Thank you, bye.
